reviews.text: Took a mental health day to enjoy the sunshine at Laity!  Had so much fun looking at the farm animals, going for a hay ride, going through the corn maze and walking through the displays of gnomes and Disney characters.  There is also a big play area for kids.  Snack bar had pies and $1 ice cream.  So worth it for the $8 admission! 🎃

Great for kids. We went on a weekday so it wasn't busy. They did raise their prices on admission and pumpkins. Still a nice time. Our little niece had fun. Nice little spots to take pictures. What differentiates this pumpkin patch from the rest is being closer to the beautiful view of the mountains in the background as you explore. Also, the red barns are gorgeous. I would have given a 5 if it wasn't that expensive for a family. Maybe making deals in the future like early birds or family passes would be nicer for families.

Wonderful place, the staff is pretty amazing! They are super friendly and they'll help you on  anything. There are so many activities to do you can easily spend a full day with the little ones.  Take advantage of the fall and go there to decompress and let your little ones have fun

It was our first time visiting today. We were pleasantly surprised. They have put some time and effort into his much they offer, especially for families. It’s a place you could easily spend at least half a day with the kids. Lots of photo opportunities to save your memories. They even have a little cafe to get some food and drinks. We ended up having the beef hot dogs, which were fairly decent 4/5. Out guy enjoyed seeing all the different kinds of animals and wanted to keep watching them. The scenes with familiar character cut outs was a nice touch. Would recommend this place for anyone, especially good for families with younger kids.

Absolutely love it. 100% all age child friendly. So many different things for kids to do at all age. Different kind of activities for different age (harder or more complicated one for older children. Simpler ones for younger children.) overall tones of space for even the youngest to run around.

Such a elegant and gorgeous little garden! Absolutely amazing! Been in Vancouver for years, and this is our first visit. We feel like in Japan! Beautiful place for photo shoot as well! A must visit if you are in Vancouver and autumn is a good season to explore!

Very beautiful but a bit smaller than expected. Has a good amount of fish to look at and a bridge that is great for pictures. Only draw back is that tickets can only be purchased online but I understand it's for scheduling purposes as the garden can be rented out for events like weddings.
Very peaceful and nice to have a stroll
Beautiful Japanese garden. We fortunately visited in late October when it was full of fall colors. We felt like we were in Kyoto for a moment.

Nitobe Memorial Garden is a pretty little garden tucked away in a corner at UBC. Not very big, yet very peaceful. One can truly feel like they are in Japan upon stepping in. Highly recommend you go on weekdays however, weekends it gets busy and very loud.
It's a nice park to go sit and people watch, night time not so safe due to homeless people constantly asking for something.
Pretty but full of sketchy peeps
It is a good spot has a bunch of stores and restaurants and a drug store
Met w older friends who are from Yukon.

This is a stoner park where alcoholics also like to hang out. It's always a good time and you'll definitely find someone new to talk to. Cops don't really care if you drink there, as long as your not causing problems. Here's a snippet from my most recent visit.

So, I am quietly enjoying a sunny afternoon at beautiful Victory Square, when this man approached a lovely couple who had been enjoying a refreshing beverage a few feet away, he proceeded to pull out a hand gun, he demanded their belongings at gun point. Another man then came in and punched the guy with the gun in the head. The man took his gun disarmed it. The crowd kept the guy there until the cops arrived. Here's a foto of the cops taking him away. Kinda fuzzy.
The farm need more information as pictures, photos with description to arise people's interest & maintain to a better condition.
Picnics...stroll around.. beautiful place.

This is my Favourite tea room!

We come here 3-4 times a year. They just know tea - served in china with scones, jam, and ever-changing baking. The people serving are so nice. Like REALLY NICE. I can’t believe I never thought to write a review before.
This as a lovely place to explore while finding the onsite geocache. It is so great to see this farm so well preserved for generations to enjoy.
It has a decent high tea option for a good price.  It is a bit out of the way, and you have to drive here, but it is quite nice.

I find the service is boring as hell but the building itself is beautiful. Definitely a place a couple would consider as an ideal church-wedding venue to tie the knot! People are kind and courteous too and very open to all walks of life.

A beautiful space. An affirming, welcoming community of believers. Incredible acoustics for whatever performance may be presented there.

Of course, all of this when they aren't wrapped in plastic and have a roof over their heads!

In the mean time, check out the various venues the congregation is meeting at until that date ... Because although the building is getting some "lifting" done, the church's spirits are being lifted elsewhere in anticipation for their return!!

The most lovely of old Churches in the lower Mainland.  All the Ministers there deliver a message of spirituality, self love and peace within. If I lived in Vancouver, I would attend regularly. It's also a terrific venue for us musicians as our jazz is very much appreciated at their Sunday Vespers, as I am privileged to play with a number of groups who perform at this service.
I tried phoning and emailing this church while visiting the Vancouver area right after Christmas. My husband and I were hoping to join in worship there. I’ve yet to get a response.
We attended the jazz vespers on Sunday. We felt welcome and a part of the community. Thank you for the wonderful music by Gabriel Palatchi from Argentina. Best vespers in Vancouver.

The local hotspot for diving. I went to complete my open-water certification this weekend, onto a good start. Lots of wildlife, bald eagles, starfish and so much more. Nice drive out there too! Plenty places to walk around, various trails and a rock bridge out to an island to climb up. Get to it!  :)
Beach, park, and bbq

Are many great Oceanside parks in and around Vancouver British Columbia but this is one of the best. Another one very close by is the one just east of lighthouse Park / point Atkinson. The name escape me at the moment. Because it is so popular, it can be very crowded on a terrific day . But if you pick a slightly off peak season day you will find yourself more or less alone spectacular seaside location.
The beach is so so.

Just a great west coast park with an awesome little trail and if you get low tide you can scurry over to the big rock! Bring good shoes (don't need to be hiking shoes, just good runners with grip) and enjoy the views! A family favorite :)
Nice little park. No bathroom though.
It's clean, on a quiet street, and there's a tree trunk curved parallel to the ground you can sit on in the shade.

Small neighbourhood park.  Has playground for younger children.  Has a picinic table, and a pathway around a field of green that isn't flat.  East end of park borders hwy on ramp and north end of temple parking lot.  Never very busy, mostly with mothers with their toddlers.  Occasionally people doing exercises, and others with their dogs, but for the most part it is quiet.
Great out of the way park. Pokemon stops for kids but no washroom or place to wash hands.

Thunderbird park is a beautiful park quiet and secure has a playing garden for kids very good place for running in the nature, easy accessable for people with disabilities who using wheelchair, in fact this park its not best one but if you living around is not bad!

Very nice park 👍 Two washrooms, really big playground for kids with water station, sand, swings. A lot of squirrel!!! Friendly and fearless! :) Two ponds with ducks, huge carp fish, turtles. Golf club near by, and outdoor pool which is excellent as well. Tennis courts. Great for celebrating birthdays. Many picnic tables
Nice and easy trail in the city, squirrel begging food every where
It is in middle of City so you have a nature in middle of buildings....
its ok long line up for covid test
Great park, lots of needles, and bathroom filthy

Best Church I've known for me!  I wasn't going to Church for quite a while. I couldn't seem to find any that i felt were for me until I met a new Christian friend and he introduced me to another and the beautiful light I seen in his eyes the love that he shared with others was just like I use to see when I was young!  What an amazing site to see and feel, but then again I've always had this within me to see what the majority of most people don't have especially after I turned 11 years old that's when my dad had all 4 of children  Baptized in the Christian church.  I am very grateful to God for many things that he has done for me.
The teaching I heard was good.  People there are approachable and nice.  A negative, I'll keep to myself for now. ☺
Went for their in-person service on Sunday. They have 4 zones designated each with social distancing protocol in place.
An extremely welcoming church with typically two services, one at 9am and another at 11am. Friendly greeters welcome you into the space. The music is moving and the speakers are thoughtful.

A beautiful community. The enormous congregation and the affluence of many of its members can seem intimidating, but don't let it stop you. Introduce yourself to anyone there and let them know you're new. You'll meet the warmest people who really love Jesus!
The mervelous sun set never expected.
Beautiful sunset, but the place is a little bit dirty and crowdy
The dirty sea but the place is nice

The burger was sloppy, but tasty.
The fries were great and plentiful.
Can be a bit crowned and noisy if you are looking for calm but nice place and a must stop for any visitor

We couldn't ask for a better experience!  Our Pastors and leadership share a passion to walk through life with individuals right where they are and to seek to help everyone live a fully surrendered life to God.
Wonderful historical building in Downtown, Vancouver, and friendly congregations!
Great experience in helping our local people in their over night/emerg. Cold sleeping. Hot meal anda bit of respect from everyone there. And I'm looking forward in help again out thus yr..
One of the best churches in Vancouver because they help the homeless and even give them a place to sleep once a week
Easy going Baptist church, welcoming all members of the community & visitors.

Great family park.  Lots of space and equipment to keep kids entertained, including a musical instrument station.  For those sunny summer days there's a waterpark to cool the kids off.  Nature lovers can enjoy the green space, forest trails, waterfall and duck pond.

Would note that during these COVID-19 times, there are washrooms; however, there's a max of 1 person at a time permitted inside the facilities.
Great community park.  Great place for family picnic. Trails, waterfall, duck pond and great playground. Fantastic park ...
Great for kids there's a water park in the summer it's set up at Christmas time and also has lots of area to fly kites & play

A gorgeous, large park. The playgrounds are  in great condition and the splash area is well laid out.

Our daughter loves the ducks and catfish as well. Loads to see and do. Plus, in the snowy weather,  it's the ultimate tobogganing place.

Sledding in the winter, splash pad, children's running water feature, vast open areas of grass and lots of other activities and two play ground structures =a lot of great options for all ages here! Fantastic park with a great story of community contributions to make the park even better.

Sewell's Marina is a great place to rent a boat and get out on the water.  We have rented boats from them for the past 3 years and found the people there to be fantastic!

They are all so friendly and helpful with questions.  The boats are consistently clean and the staff are excellent in providing you with all of the information needed to have an enjoyable and safe experience.

The location of this marina is excellent as once you get out of the harbour, you are immediately in the scenic surroundings of Howe sound.

We feel extremely safe with Sewell's boats we have rented.  Should any problems arise, they are just a cellular phone call away and their boats are all equipped with GPS in the unlikely even you need to be located for assistance.

The first time we rented, we went with the smaller horsepower motor.  The last two times we ended up going with the 90 hp boats and found them so much fun.  You can quickly move up to the sound and seal watch as well as explore other islands in such a short time.

We will try to rent again later in the year and perhaps try fishing or even look into their fishing charters.

Had a good experience renting a boat from this company. The staff was friendly, the rates were reasonable and the location is great. The boat rental included the price of gas which is great as I knew exactly what to expect to pay upon return. Would definitely book with Sewell's again!

Fast and easy service. I was surprised at how great the condition of the boats were! John was very helpful.

Leaving from Sewell’s Marina is so much better than the harbour just because you are right in the middle of the scenic area.

Very good customer service. Staff was helpful and maintain covid precautions. 16 feet boat accommodated 2 adults and 4 kids and whole 3 hrs trip around Anvil and Gabriola islands was so much fun for whole family.
Great place to rent a motor boat. With friendly service and importance of safety measures. The boating area is one of the most breathtaking place you'll ever see.

Great place to spend some time learning about the history of how the VPD was established, major city events, and fascinating criminal cases. The building itself is full of history and interesting facts. The museum curator was extremely friendly and very knowledgeable.
The place is a bit small for a museum but there is quite a lot of good readings and artifacts. Specially liked the morgue section of the museum.

Its always amazing to see where we came from...
Absolutely need to stop here if you like law enforcement history.

Staff were A+ to!
Very informative museum. Takes about 1-3 hours depending upon your interest. The tissue samples collections have been amazing.
Interesting artifacts and knowledgeable guides. Fun and weird stories and cool crime solving activities.
Great little presentation about the morgue and some of the residents still haunting the place. Interesting and fun
If you are looking a winery experience, turn around right now...there are plenty of wineries nearby. Don’t waste your time here.

My wife and i drove  passing by the winery by chance and dropped in.
The staff is very friendly and knowledgable. She invited us to take a wine taste so we did. We tried 3, which turned to be nice to us.
Highly suggested to go visiting them
Delicious only sold here wine, cranberries grown on property all other fruit in the wine is locally grown. Very good fruit wine, with tons to choose from! Nice place, nice people!

Visited this fruit wine place after a long time. The wine seem the same as I remember. Bought a few ice wines and regular table wines. The place didn't have many people when we went but to be fair it's out of the way sort of. I like their fruit wine. If sweet fruit wine is your thing. This place won't disappoint.
Terrible staff. They prefer keep having their conversations instead of communicating with costumers. Nothing interesting to see, just a very small store
I don’t actually hate it. It’s not terrible as long as you are not here from 3-5pm and (during that time kids playing games scream here like a fire alarm) Clean washrooms as well

Easy access from Skytrain or 25 bus. Events are well organized. The Book Launch for Hustling Verse was well organized with good sound and seating and well organized for signing books. The Culture US event, Canvas and Coffee was simply fantastic. Again the site had everything well organized for the painter/facilitator and the participants. One of my favorite People Places in Vancouver.

Lots of good things for children. We go to music together regularly, but also been to other activities, like breakfast with Santa, or... Just watching other people play ping pong (my daughter likes doing that for some reason)

Beautiful and well maintained venue. Lots of activities and amenities for all ages. Staff are very friendly and welcoming.

Washrooms and water fountains located inside with some seating in the area (both indoor and out). Limited parking in the area, with some paid meter parking nearby the park.

It's a nice community center with lot of options for everyone to participate in activities.  The staff are friendly.  You can register for activities online very easily or go to the reception where they will help you.

My son attended the karate classes there, and he liked it there a lot!  He made lots of friends.  After class they used to play fuseball and table tennis.  The David Lam Park is right across the road.

I love this beautiful old theatre. I look forward to every visit. The ambiance is excellent, the sound is superb, and the Vancouver Symphony Orchestra always puts on a wonderful show. If you have long legs, take an aisle! The seats can be a bit tight if you’re plus sized and there isn’t a ton of leg room but the show is well worth it!  I always sit in the balcony, because I like the view from above the stage.
Beautiful, beautiful, beautiful! Fabulous location and staff that made our visit an excellent experience. Thank you Orpheum crew!
Such a beautiful theater. Watched Mark Knopfler perform last year and sat in the Dress Circle. Had a great view of the entire stage.

It was amazing to see my first love show here.
We sat up in the top area, third row and had a great show of the Wiggles.  At two years old my daughter had an amazing time. Sitting on my lap, we danced and sung along. Id recommend The Orpheum to anyone on Vancouver Island, such an experience.

Thank-you

The Orpheum is just a beautiful venue. The theatre is like something out of a movie, with the plush red carpet, brass bannisters, and ornate decorations, it’s just beautifully designed. There is also a lot of really cool history on display, including pictures of artists inducted into the B.C. Entertainment Hall of Fame. They also have plenty of concessions available though you meed to know to head upstairs as there is typically a longer lineup downstairs.
Fun to see the animals, my young kids loved it. Pumpkins in the patch weren't that big or varied in colour (ie no white ones) but we still have an awesome time :)
My first pumpkin patch 😊 The Safarmi was organized very well, though we had to wait for few minutes to park the car and go to pumpkin patch. Overall loved the farm, animals and the pumpkin patch

Great people to do business with, just in general the Anderson family is whole hearted and business oriented.

Jacob Voronov
Big Moose PowerWashing Inc.
Very well organized, the kids loved it.  We would definitely go again and highly recommend it.

WOW! What an awesome experience and great out of the box thinking with the Safarmi. This has gone totally viral with all my buddies (no pun intended). Brought my family the other day and my kids LOVED it. Perfect way to get them out of the house and enjoy some sunshine and fun times from the relative comfort and safety of our car :)
A must visit sunset view
I go here for overcrowded beaches and sunsets.

Great morning! Went for a bike ride around Stanley Park and ended up on Sunset Beach. I would highly recommend this beach and the  surrounding area for either a walk on the various walk ways and paths..or bike ride on either side of False Creek area.
Just down the road u can take a ferry across that will get u to Granville Isand for a selection of nice places to eat. As well there is a winding path way along the water at Granville Island on False Creek that leads youto the end by SCIENCE World. Lots to see and do. A must see for tourists.

Good beach but water is sometimes sus. If you want good water quality for swimming, go to second or third beach. Great for sand or grass activities due to large amounts of FLAT area (no slopes, no tree roots). The roller hockey rink and skateboarding area are great too. Watch for police on bikes looking to poor out alcohol on a warm Friday night.

This is a fantastic park. It's a Vancouver milestone if your asking me. The planetarium close by. Kits beach just off your shoulder. And a great beach, board walk. Gotta love our home!! We are lucky. Let's celebrate that, in a humble and safe way though.
Amazing space and environment for music. Fantastic events hosted here! Vintage, cozy and intimate.
Cool local gallery and performance space.
Great place for art, dance, music or artistic expression in general
Jane Ellison's classes are a national treasure.
Love love love Western Front! They always have the most interesting exhibitions in the city
